Chewing gum is another stop smoking aid that has been around for a long time. This particular delivery method has been on the market for a long time. One of the newer products of this type is Equate. Be aware that this is a nicotine delivery replacement product, but the gum still contains nicotine. As with other stop smoking aids, you have to be motivated to quit smoking. Sugary chewing gum is also unhealthy, did you realize that? Increasing the saliva is what chewing gum does, and this profits you by cutting down the bacterium in your mouth, but sweetened gum winds up putting back sugars and crystals that saliva has rinsed away. Chips, hard bread sticks and crackers are not good for your teeth as well. Despite the fact that fruit is basically healthful, dehydrated fruit is horrible for your teeth. Moreover, and you will be excited to hear this: do not eat raisins at all. Teeth are ruined by raisins!
</p><p>
Make sure plenty of calcium is in your diet. People for the most part achieve this by drinking milk in big quantities, however there are other ways to get it. Green veggies are loaded with calcium and are good for your body. Assuming someone is having difficulty obtaining foods loaded in calcium, they can eat Tums a couple of times during the day and that can be very beneficial. Talk to your doctor before you adopt this habit. Most of the time though, your doctor will tell you that a Tums is for more than easing stomach issues: it's a great source of calcium too, and your teeth need calcium to stay healthy for as long as possible.
</p><p>
In the past dentists believed that if the enamel on your teeth had worn away, that there wasn't anything they could be do to replace it. These days however, there are toothpastes that can help in rebuilding enamel on your teeth so you can replace what has been lost and it also helps makes your teeth stronger. It is a good idea to brush with these pastes every once in a while to give your mouth the added boost it needs. Using these pastes every day is something you might want to try if your teeth are particularly susceptible to decay, and if recommended by your dentist, perhaps even twice a day. Isn't it amazing how just simple common sense can make a difference in good oral hygiene. Good teeth care doesn't have to involve lots of expensive dental treatments or cosmetic enhancements. One of the main but simple requirements for keeping your mouth fresh and clean is a healthy lifestyle. A healthy diet, daily brushing and flossing are often all you will need. Sometimes though, hints like these can help you step up your game and gain even more protection.

Everyone brushes their teeth, but many people don't do it properly. Just moving the brush around for a few seconds isn't going to help you very much. Most people don't brush long enough (dentists suggest at least 2 minutes) or frequently enough (at least 2x per day). They say that spending at least thirty seconds "scrubbing" each of the quadrants of your mouth is a good goal.

Set a timer if you have to. If you don't time yourself, you'll probably quit brushing too soon. Using fluoride toothpaste when brushing your teeth is a good practice. In the United States, some but not all states add fluoride to their drinking water. Since the fluoride added to the drinking water in those states isn't that high in concentration it cannot take the place of a good fluoride toothpaste. Fluoride coats the enamel of your teeth and bonds to it so that germs and bacteria have a harder time taking hold of your teeth and causing problems. There isn't as much protection when you use a non fluoride toothpaste. Instead of getting rid of them, that stuff will just move the germs around.
